[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: set_rewards_unsafe()] [Reward Overwrite] Can set_rewards_unsafe() at line 278 be called with an artificially high value to inflate total_rewards without corresponding SUI backing, breaking the ratio invariant? (Critical)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: sub_rewards_unsafe()] [Reward Underflow] At line 285, if value > self.total_rewards, total_rewards is clamped to 0 - but does this properly account for collected_rewards, potentially making get_total_rewards() underflow later? (High)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: sub_rewards_unsafe()] [Inconsistent State] Does sub_rewards_unsafe() emit RewardsUpdated with self.total_rewards, but if collected_rewards is non-zero, is the effective reward calculation in get_ratio() now misaligned? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: mut_collected_rewards()] [Direct Mutation Risk] Can mut_collected_rewards() at line 590 be abused by package functions to set collected_rewards > total_rewards, breaking the invariant and causing get_total_rewards() underflow? [File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: unstake_amount_from_validators()] [Fee Bypass] At lines 454-456, if calculate_reward_fee() returns 0 due to rounding for small reward amounts, can attackers accumulate uncollected rewards in the pool? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: unstake_amount_from_validators()] [Reward Accounting Mismatch] At line 456, sub_rewards_unsafe(self, rewards) is called with gross rewards, but only reward_fee is added to collectable_reward - is there a reward leakage? (High)
